organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: Perinatal Outcomes Following Change in Clinical Criteria in for Treatment of Maternal Hypertension
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Observational Study of Perinatal Outcomes Following Change in Clinical Criteria in for Treatment of Maternal Hypertension

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is observe outcomes before and after a change in clinical practice in the threshold for management of severe hypertension in pregnancy and the post-partum period. Outcomes will be observed for 10 months under the current (traditional) clinical blood pressure threshold for acute treatment of hypertension, which is \>= 160 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) systolic blood pressure (SBP). This will be followed by one month of education about rationale for the new SBP threshold of \>= 180 mmHg and change of clinical guidelines. Then, there will be 10 months of observation after adopting the updated clinical threshold for acute antihypertensive treatment (\>= 180 SBP).

armGroups.label: Traditional clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 160 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension
interventionNames: Procedure: Clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 160 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension

armGroups.label: Updated clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 180 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension
interventionNames: Procedure: Clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 180 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension

interventions.name: Clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 160 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension
interventions.description: Patients are treated for hypertension if SBP \>= 160 mmHg.
armGroupLabels: Traditional clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 160 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension

interventions.name: Clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 180 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension
interventions.description: Patients are treated for hypertension if SBP \>= 180 mmHg.
armGroupLabels: Updated clinical blood pressure threshold of SBP >= 180 mmHg for acute treatment of hypertension

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with Congestive Heart Failure/Pulmonary Edema, hemorrhagic or ischemic Stroke, Acute Kidney Injury (creatinine > 1.5mg/dL), and/or or Myocardial Ischemia.
primaryOutcomes.description: The primary outcome is a composite outcome, and will be reported as number of patients who have Congestive Heart Failure/Pulmonary Edema, hemorrhagic or ischemic Stroke, Acute Kidney Injury (creatinine \> 1.5mg/dL), and/or Myocardial Ischemia.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the time of delivery hospitalization (about 2 days to 3 months)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with non-reassuring fetal heart rate tracing (NR-FHRT) requiring caesarean delivery
Number of patients with Apgar score < 7 at 5 min
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Apgar score indicates the status of the newborn infant immediately after birth. Apgar score ranges from 0-10, with a higher score indicating a better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the time of delivery hospitalization (about 2 days to 3 months)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with placental abruption
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the time of delivery hospitalization (about 2 days to 3 months)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome (PRES)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the time of delivery hospitalization (about 2 days to 3 months)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients with hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets (HELLP) syndrome
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the time of delivery hospitalization (about 2 days to 3 months)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* any individual \> 20 weeks' gestation in triage or admitted at Children's Memorial Hermann Hospital (CMHH) and with blood pressure with \>= 160/110 mmHg

Exclusion Criteria:

* Active seizure, stroke, Congestive Heart Failure (CHF)/pulmonary edema, acute kidney injury (AKI), or myocardial infarction (MI)
* A history of stroke, CHF, chronic kidney disease (CKD), MI
* Have Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets (HELLP) syndrome or thrombocytopenia (platelets \< 100×10\^9/L)
* Persistent neurologic symptoms including headache \>8/10 one hour after analgesic or blurry vision/loss of vision
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Any individual \> 20 weeks' gestation in triage or admitted at Children's Memorial Hermann Hospital (CMHH) in Houston, Texas and with blood pressure with \>= 160/110 mmHg

overallOfficials.name: Kristen Cagino, MD
